# 0 â€” Setup & Data Loading

## 0.1 Packages

```{r packages}
library(tidyverse)
library(scales)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
```

## 0.2 SOC Crosswalk â€” All 9 SHRS Programs

```{r crosswalk}
soc_crosswalk <- tribble(
  ~shrs_program, ~shrs_dept,  ~soc_code,  ~occupation_title,
  "SLP",         "CSD",       "29-1127",  "Speech-Language Pathologists",
  "AuD",         "CSD",       "29-1181",  "Audiologists",
  "HIM",         "HIM",       "29-9021",  "Health Information Technologists and Medical Registrars",
  "OTD",         "RST",       "29-1122",  "Occupational Therapists",
  "DPT",         "RST",       "29-1123",  "Physical Therapists",
  "PAS",         "PAS",       "29-1071",  "Physician Assistants",
  "AT",          "SMN",       "29-9091",  "Athletic Trainers",
  "DN",          "SMN",       "29-1031",  "Dietitians and Nutritionists",
  "SS",          "SMN",       "29-1128",  "Exercise Physiologists"
)

target_socs <- soc_crosswalk$soc_code
```

## 0.3 Load the 2024â€“2034 Projections Data

```{r load-data}
# â”€â”€ EDIT THIS PATH to match your machine â”€â”€
PROJ_CSV_PATH <- file.path(path.expand("~"), "Documents", "SHRS_Analysis",
                            "market_analysis", "v3data", "projections_csv",
                            "occupation_csv", "occupation_2024.csv")

raw_2024 <- read_csv(PROJ_CSV_PATH, show_col_types = FALSE)

# Standardize column names
names(raw_2024) <- c(
  "occ_title", "soc_code", "occ_type",
  "emp_2024", "emp_2034",
  "emp_change_num", "emp_change_pct",
  "lf_exit_rate", "occ_transfer_rate", "total_sep_rate",
  "lf_exits", "occ_transfers", "total_separations",
  "annual_openings"
)

# Clean numeric fields (remove commas, coerce)
raw_2024 <- raw_2024 |>
  mutate(across(c(emp_2024:annual_openings), ~ {
    x <- str_remove_all(as.character(.x), ",")
    x <- na_if(x, "â€”")
    x <- na_if(x, "--")
    as.numeric(x)
  }))
```

## 0.4 Extract Benchmarks & SHRS Subset

```{r benchmarks}
# All-occupations benchmark (row 1, soc_code = 00-0000)
all_occ <- raw_2024 |> filter(soc_code == "00-0000")
all_occ_growth_pct   <- all_occ$emp_change_pct
all_occ_sep_rate     <- all_occ$total_sep_rate
all_occ_openings     <- all_occ$annual_openings

cat("All-Occupations benchmark (2024-2034):\n")
cat("  Growth:", all_occ_growth_pct, "%\n")
cat("  Sep rate:", all_occ_sep_rate, "%\n")
cat("  Annual openings:", comma(all_occ_openings * 1000), "\n")

# Filter to SHRS targets only
proj_2024 <- raw_2024 |>
  filter(soc_code %in% target_socs, occ_type == "Line item") |>
  left_join(soc_crosswalk, by = "soc_code") |>
  select(shrs_program, shrs_dept, soc_code, occ_title = occupation_title,
         emp_2024, emp_2034, emp_change_num, emp_change_pct,
         lf_exit_rate, occ_transfer_rate, total_sep_rate,
         lf_exits, occ_transfers, total_separations, annual_openings) |>
  arrange(shrs_dept, shrs_program)

cat("\nSHRS programs loaded:", nrow(proj_2024), "of 9 expected\n")
cat("Programs found:", paste(proj_2024$shrs_program, collapse = ", "), "\n")
```

# 1 â€” Employment Growth Analysis

```{r growth-bar, fig.height=6}
proj_2024 |>
  mutate(
    above_benchmark = emp_change_pct >= all_occ_growth_pct,
    health = case_when(
      emp_change_pct >= all_occ_growth_pct * 2 ~ "Strong (â‰¥2Ã— avg)",
      emp_change_pct >= all_occ_growth_pct     ~ "Healthy (â‰¥ avg)",
```

# 2 â€” Job Openings & Replacement Demand

Job openings arise from two sources: **growth** (new positions) and
**replacement** (retirement, career changes). Even slow-growth fields can have
robust hiring if turnover is high.

## 2.1 Components of Annual Openings

```{r openings-components, fig.height=6}
         `Growth` = growth_component) |>
```

# 4 â€” Program-Level Scorecard (0â€“100 Scale)

Each dimension is scored on a 0â€“100 continuous scale using min-max normalization
across the 9 SHRS programs, then combined into a composite score.

## 4.1 Compute Scores

```{r scorecard-compute}
# Min-max rescaler: maps values to 0-100
rescale_0_100 <- function(x) {
  rng <- range(x, na.rm = TRUE)
  if (rng[2] == rng[1]) return(rep(50, length(x)))
  round((x - rng[1]) / (rng[2] - rng[1]) * 100, 1)
}

scorecard_2024 <- proj_2024 |>
  mutate(
    # Raw scores (0-100 via min-max across 9 programs)
    growth_score     = rescale_0_100(emp_change_pct),
    openings_score   = rescale_0_100(annual_openings),
    sep_rate_score   = rescale_0_100(total_sep_rate),
    emp_scale_score  = rescale_0_100(emp_2024),

    # Composite: equal weight across 4 dimensions
    composite_score  = round((growth_score + openings_score +
                               sep_rate_score + emp_scale_score) / 4, 1),

    # Health signal based on composite
    health_signal = case_when(
      composite_score >= 65 ~ "Green",
      composite_score >= 40 ~ "Yellow",
      TRUE                  ~ "Red"
    ),
    health_signal = factor(health_signal, levels = c("Green", "Yellow", "Red"))
  )
```

**Scorecard methodology:**

- Composite = simple average of the 4 dimension scores.
- Health signal: Green (â‰¥65), Yellow (40â€“64), Red (<40).
